required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Comparison of 27+® and 23-gauge ULTRAVIT® 7500 Cpm Vitrectomy Outcomes
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Comparison of 27+® and 23-gauge ULTRAVIT® 7500 Cpm Vitrectomy Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the treatment day change between immediate postoperative and immediate preoperative intraocular pressure (IOP) between 27-gauge and 23-gauge vitrectomy instruments.

detailed_description.textblock: Required follow-up for this study is 3 months post treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change in IOP on Operative Day
primary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) will be assessed using the study specified tono-pen and is measured in millimeters of mercury (mmHg). Change is defined as the difference between immediate postoperative IOP and immediate preoperative IOP. A greater change in IOP may indicate a less stable posterior chamber and/or a more invasive surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Conjunctival Edema Score at Week 1
secondary_outcome.description: Conjunctival edema (swelling) will be assessed during examination by the investigator and graded using a score of 0-3, where 0=Absent and 3=Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Post-operative Pain Rating at Day 1
secondary_outcome.description: The subject will be asked to rate post-operative pain in the study eye using a score of 0-10, where 0=no pain and 10=the worst pain imaginable.

arm_group.description: CONSTELLATION 27-gauge combined surgical pak used during vitrectomy surgery
CONSTELLATION 23-gauge combined surgical pak used during vitrectomy surgery

intervention.description: Sterile single-use supplies necessary to perform 1 vitrectomy surgery: 1 ULTRAVIT® 27-gauge 7500 cuts per minute (cpm) vitrectomy probe and a 27-gauge EDGEPLUS Valved Entry System comprised of 3 trocar/cannulas and related accessories.

Sterile single-use supplies necessary to perform 1 vitrectomy surgery: 1 ULTRAVIT® 23-gauge 7500 cuts per minute (cpm) vitrectomy probe and a 23-gauge EDGEPLUS trocar/cannula set comprising of 3 trocars/cannulas and related accessories.
Microincisional pars plana vitrectomy (PPV) surgery for the treatment of various vitreoretinal diseases ranging from simple to advanced cases
